helpArticles.question: Switching your business account to Monzo Business

answer.answer:
Here's how to switch your business account to Monzo Business with the Current Account Switching Service (CASS):

- Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar of your app
- Scroll down and tap the __Switch to Monzo__ button 

You'll need:

- The account number and sort code of the account you want to switch from
- The last 5 digits of your other account‚Äôs card (if you're a sole trader)

You'll also need to enter some information, which we'll match against your old bank account. If your old bank account has out-of-date information, make sure to get in touch with them and check everything's up to date.

üôÖ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è You can only switch business accounts to Monzo Business, not personal accounts.

helpArticles.question: Eligibility for Monzo Business

answer.answer:
You can apply for a Monzo Business account if:

- You‚Äôre a sole trader or registered limited company by shares (LTD)
- You‚Äôre based in the UK
- You only pay tax in the UK

If you‚Äôre a LTD, to be eligible your company needs to:

- Have an active status on [Companies House](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/companies-house) (we can‚Äôt support dormant companies)
- Have an active company director (not disqualified) on Companies House
- Have at least one person of significant control (this can be you) listed on Companies House
- Have no corporate persons of significant control or corporate directors
- Make money mostly from selling goods and/or providing services, not mostly from interest or investment income

We might offer accounts to other business types in future but it‚Äôs not in our plans at the moment. That‚Äôs because we have to gather and store different information on these customers, and there are different rules around how these types of accounts need to be operated.

Sole traders and LTDs make up around 90% of UK businesses, so we‚Äôre focusing on supporting them right now.

__Sign up__

If you're eligible for an account, [sign up for Monzo Business](https://monzo.com/i/business/sign-up-for-business) üíº

helpArticles.question: Paying in a cheque to your Monzo Business account

answer.answer:
You can pay cheques into your Monzo Business account by posting them to us for free using Freepost. For higher-value cheques, you might feel more comfortable using tracked postage instead ‚Äì but you don't have to üëç

__Cheque guidelines for sole traders and limited companies__

If you're a sole trader and want to pay in a cheque, it needs be made out to your legal name.

If you own a limited company and want to pay in a cheque, it needs to be made out to your company's registered name.

__Using Freepost üìÆ__

1. Write your 8 digit account number on the back of the cheque in the top left corner. (To find your account number, open the Monzo app, tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar, then tap the __Account__ button under your Monzo card. If you can't find this button, swipe down on your list of payments.)
2. Make sure the name on your cheque matches the name on your account. (To check this, open the Monzo app, tap your profile picture in the top left of the screen, tap the settings cog icon in the top right of the screen, then tap your name.)
3. Take a photo of the front and back of your cheque, as a copy.
4. Write __FREEPOST MONZO__ (nothing else!) on the envelope and post it to us. You don't need to use a stamp.
5. It'll take 2 to 3 weeks to see the money in your account. That's 7-10 days to reach us, then 4 working days to process. We'll send you an app notification when we start processing your cheque.

__Using tracked postage üè§__

1. Follow steps 1 to 3 above üëÜ
2. Post your cheque to: Monzo, 6th Floor, 38 Finsbury Square, London, EC2A 1PX.
3. We'll send you an app notification when we start processing your cheque. It‚Äôll take 4 working days from that point.

helpArticles.question: What is a Tax Pot?

answer.answer:
A __Pot__ is a space in your account where you can separate out your money from your main balance.

A __Tax Pot__ is a really simple way to automatically separating a percentage of your income to give you complete peace of mind when it comes to paying tax.

You simply select the portion of your earnings that you would like to save, and we'll move it into your Tax Pot every time you get paid!

You can add and withdraw money from your Tax Pot at any point, too!

helpArticles.question: I can't see my Pots in my FreeAgent/Xero Account

answer.answer:
You should be seeing the total balance of your account, including the balance that is held in Pots. Since Pots aren't actually a separate account they won't display in your FreeAgent/Xero account as such - that includes any movements in and out of Pots. 

So, if you have ¬£1,000 in your main Monzo account and ¬£500 stashed away in a Pot, your total balance is ¬£1,500 and this is the balance you will see in your FreeAgent/Xero account.

However what you will see is your total balance of your account. So if you have ¬£1,000 in your main Monzo account and ¬£500 stashed away in a Pot, your total balance is ¬£1,500 and this is the balance you will see in your FreeAgent/Xero account.

helpArticles.question: My balance in my Monzo account and my FreeAgent/Xero account don't match up

answer.answer:
There are 2 reasons why this might be happening. 

1. Your transactions will sync with FreeAgent/Xero every 24 hours, therefore if you have made transactions in the last 24 hours these will have changed your balance in your Monzo account but will not have yet been reflected in your FreeAgent/Xero account. If you head over to your "Account" tab and scroll down to "Accounting Tools" you should be able to see when the last sync happened
2. Since Pots aren't actually a separate account they won't display in your FreeAgent/Xero account as such. However what you will see is your total balance of your account. So if you have ¬£1,000 in your main Monzo account and ¬£500 stashed away in a Pot, your total balance is ¬£1,500 and this is the balance you will see in your FreeAgent/Xero account. 

If you think that your balance is still not right, and the above doesn't seem to explain the reason for us, you can contact us in the in app chat here.

helpArticles.question: I can't see my old transactions in my FreeAgent/Xero Account

answer.answer:
Only the transactions that you have made after setting up the integration will by sync up with your FreeAgent/Xero account.

For the moment any previous transactions will have to be manually uploaded. We're hoping to be able to sync up older transactions automatically in a future version.

helpArticles.question: I had manually created a Monzo account with FreeAgent/Xero and now I have a duplicated account

answer.answer: If you had previously created a Monzo Business account within your FreeAgent/Xero account with the correct sort code and account number then when you set up the integration your transactions should start syncing to the correct account. If you however created an account with no (or a different) sort code and/or account number, then when you set up the integration a new Monzo Business account will be created. For now, you'll need to migrate your transactions over manually.

helpArticles.question: One of my transactions isn't appearing in FreeAgent / Xero / Quickbooks

answer.answer:
Only settled transactions will sync to FreeAgent/Xero/Quickbook. You can check if a transaction has settled by clicking on the transaction in your feed and scrolling to the bottom. If it says "pending" above the merchant name, the transaction hasn't settled yet. Once it settles, it will appear in your accounting tool after the next sync.

For Xero and FreeAgent, transactions sync every 24 hours , to see when the last sync happpened, head over to your "Account" tab and scroll down to "Accounting Tools" you should be able to see when the last sync happened.

In QuickBooks, transactions sync every time you tap **Update** on the Banking tab of your QuickBooks Online account.

helpArticles.question: How do I disconnect my Monzo account from FreeAgent/Xero?

answer.answer:
1. From your Monzo Business Account Menu tap on your "Account" tab
2. Scroll down to "Accounting Tools" and select the integration you want to disconnect 
3. Press "Disconnect" and you're done! No more transactions will be sent to the partner.

Bear in mind that by disconnecting the integration you will be stopping any further transactions getting synced however you will not be deleting any transactions that have already synced in the past.

helpArticles.question: How do I disconnect my Monzo account from QuickBooks?

answer.answer:
Before disconnecting your account, make sure you match or delete all of the downloaded transactions on the account. QuickBooks won‚Äôt let you make changes if there are still pending transactions.

1. From your [**QuickBooks Online**](https://qbo.intuit.com/login?_gl=1*gomohr*_gcl_aw*R0NMLjE1NzE3Mzc4MzguRUFJYUlRb2JDaE1JZ3NEMTJNdXY1UUlWVUVIVENoMy1rUUR4RUFBWUFTQUFFZ0o2Z1BEX0J3RQ..*_gcl_dc*R0NMLjE1NzE3Mzc4MzguRUFJYUlRb2JDaE1JZ3NEMTJNdXY1UUlWVUVIVENoMy1rUUR4RUFBWUFTQUFFZ0o2Z1BEX0J3RQ) account tap on the **Banking** tab
2. On the **Banking** tab, select the bank account you want to disconnect, and tap on the pencil icon on the top right corner and then select **Edit Account Info**
3. Select **Disconnect this account on save** and tap **Save** 
4. Your Monzo account is now disconnected from your QuickBooks account
